You are given a shot that contains a small controlled amount of a bacteria. Your immune system immediately sets up a counter-offensive\nto keep you from getting sick from it. Then your immune system 'remembers' that\ntype of experience to keep you healthy.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This means vaccines evoke cell memory\nby their actions. It operates behind the scenes of our subconscious\nmind.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decisions are made in\nthe mind\u2014choices are made in the gut.&nbsp;\nChoices come from your essence and attunement to your higher self. This explains when as a Captain , I chew up a\ncrew member&nbsp; for letting down the team,\nhe gets severe intestinal gut cramps. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">And why\nanti-depressants&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">targeting</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;the brain solely, causes nausea. This means the\nbrain and the gut are like Siamese twins. When one gets upset, the other one\ngets upset too. Half the nerve cells are situated in the gut. When I have a\nheadache I always target my gut by having an </span></span>alkaseltzer<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">, and it have never failed to\nwork 100%, withing 5 minutes. &nbsp; If your gut is unhealthy, your immunity lowers. Later the two nervous systems connect via a\ncable called the </span></span>vagus<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> nerve \u2014 the longest of all the cranial nerves . The\n</span></span>vagus<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> nerve meanders from the brain stem through the neck and finally ends up\nin the abdomen. There\u2019s the brain-gut connection.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/--iAGxVelFMg/UF6LgtnRuXI/AAAAAAAAS60/wGdHsKyNbdY/s1600/250px-Gray793.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/--iAGxVelFMg/UF6LgtnRuXI/AAAAAAAAS60/wGdHsKyNbdY/s640/250px-Gray793.png\" height=\"640\" width=\"276\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vagus nerve upon\nleaving the medulla between the medullary pyramid and the inferior cerebellar\npeduncle, it extends through the jugular foramen, then passing into the carotid\nsheath between the internal carotid artery and the internal jugular vein down\nbelow the head, to the neck, chest and abdomen, where it contributes to the\ninnervation of the viscera. Besides output to the various organs in the body,\nthe vagus nerve conveys sensory information about the state of the body's\norgans to the central nervous system. 80-90% of the nerve fibers in the vagus\nnerve are afferent (sensory) nerves communicating the state of the viscera to\nthe brain.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">This means your psychological\nhealth, is partly derived from the </span></span>heathy<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"> gut. The conditioned reflex\nworks by association. Rather than a simple stimulus-response mechanism, the\nconditioned reflex is associated with memory.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, during the shock and\nstress of an event that is perceived as a physical or emotional threat, a\nspecial complex of hormonal messenger molecules are released by the\nlimbic-hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal system. These substances encode all the\nexternal and internal sensory impressions of the perceived threat as cellular\nmemory.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iyeUsTcrRyU/UF4IyD28FRI/AAAAAAAASxU/tN9y7AtZRzQ/s1600/imagesBJLPP.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-iyeUsTcrRyU/UF4IyD28FRI/AAAAAAAASxU/tN9y7AtZRzQ/s320/imagesBJLPP.jpg\" height=\"238\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;This initial stimulus, or memory, can later act as a catalyst for the\nsame reflex response that was initiated by the perceived threat. The reflex or\nresponse can then become conditioned to produce the same basic reaction each\ntime the memory of the initial threat is activated, regardless of the stimulus.\nThis process is known as stimulus generalization, and it becomes a key element\nin understanding, and treating, victims of trauma.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The body is also\nconstantly generating these universal scalar waves. Scalar waves are produced\nwhen two electromagnetic waves of the same frequency are exactly out of phase\n(opposite to each other) and the amplitudes subtract and cancel or destroy each\nother. The result is not exactly an annihilation of magnetic fields but a\ntransformation of energy back into a scalar wave. This scalar field has\nreverted back to a vacuum state of potentiality.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fhQrxY1cfXs/UF4JmfEDskI/AAAAAAAASyM/v0zdoqq02V8/s1600/imagesLOUY654.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-fhQrxY1cfXs/UF4JmfEDskI/AAAAAAAASyM/v0zdoqq02V8/s320/imagesLOUY654.jpg\" height=\"256\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Every atom and molecule\nwithin us depends on the rest of the universe. font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cells are constantly\ngrowing and dying they are the ultimate reflection of how the universe works.\nThe universe is constantly changing, constantly transforming chaos to order,\ndarkness into light and requires all who inhabit it. So either we make the\nconscious decision to live and grow or do nothing, which is a personal choice.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Our body is like a\nriver, it may look the same but water gets changed all the time. &nbsp;98% of our body renews itself every 8 years. &nbsp;Our skin renews itself every 28 days, our blood\nplasma every ten days, white blood cells renew three weeks, red blood cells every\n120 days, entire blood in four months, cornea replaces every 24 hours, &nbsp;the soft tissue every 6 months, and the dense\ntissue every 4 years, stomach lining turns over every 4 days, the villi which\nabsorbs nutrients in the small intestine renews every 3 days, the skeleton will\ncompletely renew itself about every ten years, the liver in 150 days, entire\nhair on head in six years , the inner lining of the cheeks in a few hours, taste\nbuds on tongue in weeks.&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Of course brain damage is permanent and heart muscle\ndamage is semi-permanent. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">ISRO SPY CASE , </span><span style=\"color: blue;\">S\nNAMBINARAYANAN</span><span style=\"color: red;\">,&nbsp; </span>INFILTRATION OF INDIAN\nSECURITY AGENCIES BY DOUBLE AGENTS</b></span></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u2AfKLitQAc/UFtSnez2VuI/AAAAAAAASjU/F5e_GGgPn1g/s1600/s-nambi-narayanan-lg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-u2AfKLitQAc/UFtSnez2VuI/AAAAAAAASjU/F5e_GGgPn1g/s320/s-nambi-narayanan-lg.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This post is in\nresponse to a reader Suresh S Namboodiri, vide my post WILL INDIA BE A BANANA\nREPUBLIC- VADAKAYIL..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My first thought was\nNO, I am too busy with other things.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then suddenly I\nrealised I has a personal connection with this case, which had given me a\nheartache.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My elder son wanted to be an astro-physicist right from a young age. &nbsp;His room used to be filled with astro posters. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An an incident happened in Kerala ,\nand I then asked my son \" What are your options? You can join ISRO or you can\njoin NASA. &nbsp;I don't want you to join NASA, which leaves ISRO \"&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">--and then I\ntold him the story of a brilliant ISRO astro-scientist Nambinarayanan.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His face all changed\nand he was downcast for a while. &nbsp;The whole day he was silent. After that he never bought any books on astro-physics.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today my elder son has a high flying job as a\ncomputer Engineer, after doing his ME at Cornell USA..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Before that--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I was home on leave\nabout 2 decades ago, and as usual I had gone to the Rotary Swimming pool at\nCalicut for a swim, in the evening.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Suddenly a 15 year old\ngirl came in front of me . She asked me if I could teach her swimming . I noticed she was very\npretty.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I had to be careful here as\nteaching swimming involves physical contact. And if something untoward happens\nthe men are always blamed, even if the girl looks like sh#t and the man is a hunk -- and here she was\na stunner..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was on a Christmas\nvacations, and&nbsp; her father was IG of\nPolice of Kerala State , Raman Srivasatava.&nbsp;\nI remember seeing her high profile father's pictures in the local\nnewspapers as he was always dressed impeccably in a suit, unlike his bumpkin\npredecessors, who had little class.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dqE_f-IdW3E/UFtS5KYwgbI/AAAAAAAASjk/C911B38qxQM/s1600/imagesdffgh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-dqE_f-IdW3E/UFtS5KYwgbI/AAAAAAAASjk/C911B38qxQM/s1600/imagesdffgh.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I guess he gave everybody an inferiority\ncomplex, as he was the CM's K.Karunakaran's blue eyed boy too. At that time our\npresent Defence minister AK Antony was Karunanakran's bitter political rival in the same\nCongress party.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The last I saw her was\non New years eve, she wanted me to be her dancing partner, as she was going for\na New Year dance at a local hotel with her parents. &nbsp;I remember calling her brother from the pther side of the pool &nbsp;and telling him to dance with his sister, and excused myself saying I had a committed\ndinner with my wife.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The real reason was my wife would have killed me for cradle snatching , if her\nfather did not.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I really liked this bubbly girl-- and sometimes felt that she was too vulnerable..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Then one fine day I saw\nthe picture of this top- cop family, on the front page of the local newspaper. They were\nstoned outside Guruvayur temple by an irate mob, who shouted that they were\ndesh drohis.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This picture with her IG father , then under suspension and brother ( probably 14 ) in\nwhite mundu, really gave me a shock.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Incidentally CM K Karunakaran always\nvisited the Guruvayur temple every month on a particular day, and the IG also\nwent on the same date, every month- a 330 km drive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So I followed the case closely.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Her father was accused\nto be an accomplice of the great astro-scientist S Nambinarayanan in selling\nour ISRO secrets .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now who was this Nambinarayanan?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was then project\ndirector of the prestigious cryogenic system project and was working on\ndeveloping an Indian cryoengine for the third stage of the GSLV.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narayanan introduced\nthe liquid fuel rocket technology in India in the early 1970s, when A. P. J. Abdul\nKalam\u2019s team was working on solid motors. He foresaw the need for liquid\nfuelled engines for ISRO\u2019s future civilian space programmes.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He was personally\nmentored and encouraged by the then ISRO chairman Satish Dhawan.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sZB9h9XEVXw/UFtXRQWtnfI/AAAAAAAASlU/2pMVFAxUd78/s1600/imagesnnmkll.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-sZB9h9XEVXw/UFtXRQWtnfI/AAAAAAAASlU/2pMVFAxUd78/s400/imagesnnmkll.jpg\" width=\"496\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narayanan developed\nliquid propellant motors, first building the successful 600-kg thrust engine in\nthe mid-1970s and thereafter moving on to bigger engines. His&nbsp; team developed the Vikas engine used by\nseveral ISRO rockets including the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle(PSLV) that\ntook Chandrayaan-1 to the moon in 2008.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Vikas engine is used in the second\nstage of PSLV and as the second and the four strap-on stages of Geo-Synchronous\nSatellite Launch Vehicle (GSLV).Nambi led the Indian team to France to work\nwith scientists there on the development of their Viking engine.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VDq_rLEPv8o/UFtXEV9n1bI/AAAAAAAASlE/6jJbBD9y8Z8/s1600/jjll.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"272\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VDq_rLEPv8o/UFtXEV9n1bI/AAAAAAAASlE/6jJbBD9y8Z8/s400/jjll.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And it was he,\nthey add, who was mostly responsible in learning the complex configurations\nthat helped the Indians to later develop the Vikas engine, an improved version\nof the Viking.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Anthony on February 27, 1995. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">42. NITROCOMPOUNDS</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">o-Chloronitrobenzene Dinitrotoluene\nNitrobenzene Nitroethane Nitropropane<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Nitropropane, Nitroethane mixture<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Nitrotoluene<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow;\">43. MISCELLANEOUS WATER SOLUTIONS</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Aluminum sulfate solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">2-Amino-2-hydroxymethyl-1,3-propanediol\nsolution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ammonium bisulfite solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ammonium nitrate-urea solution (not\ncontaining ammonia)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ammonium polyphosphate solution Ammonium\nsulfate solution Ammonium thiosulfate solution Sulfonated polyacrylate\nsolutions2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Calcium bromide solution Calcium\nchloride solution Clay slurry<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Corn syrup<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Dextrose solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">2,4-Dichlorophenoxyacetic acid,\nDiethanolamine salt solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">2,4-Dichlorophenoxyacetic acid,\nTriisopropanolamine salt solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Diethanolamine salt of 2,4-\nDichlorophenoxyacetic acid solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Diethylenetriamine pentaacetic acid,\npentasodium salt solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Dodecyl diphenyl ether disulfonate\nsolution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Drilling brine (containing Calcium,\nPotassium or<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium salts)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Drilling brine (containing Zinc salts)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Drilling mud (low toxicity) (if\nnon-flammable or non-combustible)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ethylenediaminetetracetic acid,\ntetrasodium salt solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ethylene, Vinyl acetate copolymer\nemulsion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ferric\nhydroxyethylethylenediaminetriacetic acid, trisodium salt solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Fish solubles (water based fish meal\nextracts) Fructose solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Fumaric adduct of Rosin, water\ndispersion<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Hexamethylenediamine adipate solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">N-(Hydroxyethyl)ethylenediaminetriacetic\nacid,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">trisodium salt solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Kaolin clay slurry Latex, liquid\nsynthetic Lignin liquor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Liquid streptomyces solubles<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">N-Methylglucamine solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">N-Methylglucamine solution (70% or less)\nNaphthenic acid, sodium salt solution Potassium chloride solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Potassium thiosulfate solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Rosin soap (disproportionated) solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sewage sludge, treated<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium alkyl sulfonate solution Sodium\nhydrogen sulfite solution Sodium polyacrylate solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium salt of Ferric\nhydroxyethylethylenediamine triacetic acid solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium silicate solution2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium sulfide solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium sulfite solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sodium tartrates, Sodium succinates\nsolution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Sulfonated polyacrylate solutions2<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Tall oil soap (disproportionated)\nsolution Tetrasodium salt of EDTA solution Triisopropanolamine salt of 2,4-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Dichlorophenoxyacetic acid solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Urea, Ammonium nitrate solution (not\ncontaining<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Ammonia)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Urea, Ammonium phosphate solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Urea solution<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Vegetable protein solution (hydrolysed)\nWater<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>CHEMICAL COMPATIBILITY\nCHART NOTES</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The accidental mixing\nof one chemical product with another inside a cargo tank or pipe may result in\na vigorous chemical reaction. Binary combinations that generate significant\nheat or produce gas can be very hazardous to personnel and property. The\npurpose of the Compatibility Guide is to indicate, in chart form, combinations\nbelieved to be dangerous. Based on information provided by the National Academy\nof Sciences, the Guide represents the latest data available to the US Coast\nGuard on chemical compatibility. Extensive use was made of direct experimental\nevidence obtained under contract to the NAS and Coast Guard.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Definition of a\nHazardous Reaction<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a first approximation,\na binary mixture is considered hazardous when the products are mixed under\nspecified conditions and the temperature rise exceeds 25C or a gas is evolved.\nIn rare cases the reaction of two components (even though non-hazardous, from\ntemperature or pressure considerations) may produce a product which is\nsignificantly more flammable or toxic than the original materials. Although no\nexamples of such a reaction are known at this time, they would be considered\nhazardous.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chart Format<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In reviewing the binary\ntest results and previous charts, it was evident that there were different\ndegrees of reactivity among the various products. Many of them are relatively\nnon-reactive (aromatic hydrocarbons, paraffins) while others form hazardous\ncombinations with many groups (inorganic acids).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The compatibility chart\nis separated into two sections, group 1 through group 22 are Reactive groups\nand group 30 through group 43 are Cargo groups. Left unassigned and available\nfor future expansion are groups 23 through 29 and those past 43. Reactive groups\ncontain products which are chemically the most reactive; dangerous combinations\nmay result between members of different Reactive groups and between members of\nReactive and Cargo groups.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Products assigned to\nCargo groups, however, are much less reactive and dangerous combinations can be\nformed only with members of certain Reactive groups. Cargo groups do not react\nhazardously with one another. Because of these differences in reactivity, a\nsignificant part of the usual two-dimensional chart has been eliminated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is not sufficient to\nonly check the USCG Table for cargo compatibility. It is also mandatory to\nconsult the \u201cExceptions List\u201d. USA Code of Federal Regulations, Book CFR 46\npart 140-155.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Example:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Caustic Soda 50% (Group\n5) Methanol (Group 20)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Table shows them to be\nnon-compatible.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alphabetical list for\nboth cargoes shows small \u201c2\u201d in front of USCG group.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exceptions list shows\nCaustic Soda 50% is compatible with Methanol and can be loaded adjacent to each\nother.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using the Guide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The following procedure\nexplains how the Guide should be used to find compatibility information: (1)\nDetermine the group numbers of the two chemicals by referring to the\nalphabetical listing of products and their corresponding groups (Table 1 of 46\nCFR 150). Many chemicals are listed under their parent names and, unless\notherwise indicated, isomers or mixtures of isomers for a particular product\nare assigned to the same group.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example:- To find\nthe group number for Isobutyl alcohol, look under the parent name Butyl\nalcohol. Similarly, the group number for para-Xylene is found under the entry\nXylene. If a chemical cannot be found in this listing, contact the Coast Guard\nfor a group determination. (2) If both group numbers do not fall between 30 and\n43 inclusive, locate on the chart one of the numbers on the left (Cargo groups)\nand the other across the top (Reactive groups). Note that if one of the group\nnumbers is between 30 and 43 it must be located on the left side. Proceed\nacross the page until the appropriate Reactive group column is intersected. The\nbox formed by the intersection will indicate one of the following: (a) blank -\nthe two products are considered compatible. (b) \"X\" - the two\nproducts are not considered compatible. (c) a letter other than an \"X\"\n- differences (deviations) in reactivity are present among the group members -\nrefer to the listing following the chart to find whether the products in\nquestion are included in the deviations. Unless the combination is specifically\ncovered on this page, it may be considered compatible.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Examples:&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Combination /Groups- Compatible?&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Butyraldehyde/ Acetic Acid 19/4 -Yes&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Allyl alcohol/ Toluene\ndiisocyanate 15/12- No&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Decene/ Ethyl benzene 30/32- Yes&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ethanolamine/ Acetone\n8/18- Yes&nbsp;</i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>Ammonia/ Dimethylformamide 6/10- No</i><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exceptions to the Guide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The hazard ratings in\nthe chart are based largely upon direct experimental data using in most cases\none of the most reactive members of the group. Combinations of other group\nmembers may display considerably less reactivity. For this reason, an experimental\nprocedure has been developed which allows a shipper to test two particular\nproducts he believes non-hazardous although an \"X\" appears in the\nchart for their corresponding groups. A data sheet is also supplied and should\nbe completed and returned to the Coast Guard for evaluation. If the combination\nis not found to be dangerously reactive, an exception will be issued.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guide to Compatibility\nof Chemicals<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Guide is based in\npart upon information provided to the Coast Guard by the National Academy of Sciences\n- U.S. Coast Guard Advisory Committee on Hazardous Materials and represents the\nlatest information available to the Coast Guard on chemical compatibility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The accidental mixing\nof one chemical cargo with another can in some cases be expected to result in a\nvigorous and hazardous chemical reaction. The generation of toxic gases, the\nheating, overflow, and rupture of cargo tanks, and fire and explosion are\npossible consequences of such reactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The purpose of the\nCompatibility Chart is to show chemical combinations believed to be dangerously\nreactive in the case of accidental mixing. It should be recognized, however,\nthat the Chart provides a broad grouping of chemicals with an extensive variety\nof possible binary combinations. Although one group, generally speaking, can be\nconsidered dangerously reactive with another group where an \"X\"\nappears on the Chart, there may exist between the groups some combinations\nwhich would not dangerously react.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Chart should\ntherefore not be used as an infallible guide. It is offered as an aid in the\nsafe loading of bulk chemical cargoes, with the recommendation that proper\nsafeguards be taken to avoid&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">accidental mixing of\nbinary mixtures for which an \"X\" appears on the Chart. Proper\nsafeguards would include consideration of such factors as avoidance of the use\nof common cargo and vent lines and carriage in adjacent tanks having a common\nbulkhead.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The following procedure\nexplains how the Guide should be used in determining compatibility information:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Determine the reactivity\ngroup of a particular product by referring to the alphabetical list in Table\n7.1.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Enter the Chart with\nthe reactivity group. Proceed across the page. An \"X\" indicates a\nreactivity group that forms an unsafe combination with the product in question.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example,\nCrotonaldehyde is listed in Table 7.1 as belonging in Group 19 (Aldehydes) and\nalso has a notation, (2), which is explained in the footnotes to Table 7.1. The\nCompatibility Chart shows that chemicals in group 19 should be segregated from\nSulfuric and Nitric acids, Caustics, Ammonia, and all types of Amines\n(Aliphatic, Alkanol, and Aromatic). Footnote (2), refers the user to Table 7.3\nwhere exceptions to the Compatibility Chart are listed. Here, Crotonaldehyde is\nlisted as also being incompatible with Group 1, non-oxidizing acids.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is recognized that\nthere are wide variations in the reaction rates of individual chemicals within\nthe broad groupings shown reactive by the Compatibility Chart. Some individual\nmaterials in one group will react violently with some of the materials in\nanother group and cause great hazard; others will react slowly, or not at all.\nAccordingly, a useful addition to the Guide would be the identification of\nspecific materials which might not follow the characteristic reactivities of\nthe rest of the materials in its Group.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vxrT9I1hnhY/UFq8FcuJnoI/AAAAAAAASf8/G_Rbm_ihfF4/s1600/PAA7140036.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vxrT9I1hnhY/UFq8FcuJnoI/AAAAAAAASf8/G_Rbm_ihfF4/s1600/PAA7140036.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "1", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/3639634869313299713/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "407322592726554417", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2012-09-19T22:39:00+05:30", "updated": "2012-10-02T08:56:01+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMzQ5MTQ4MzYxODU1Cm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/09/sarsaparilla-nannarithe-quantum-sherbet.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/407322592726554417", "title": "SARSAPARILLA, NANNARI,THE QUANTUM SHERBET DRINK- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">SARSAPARILLA&nbsp;</span>, <span style=\"color: blue;\">NANNARI</span> , THE QUANTUM SHERBET DRINK - &nbsp;CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VWefboWumNM/UFn4oyK3qDI/AAAAAAAASd8/cxJJhLQs0pM/s1600/Indian-Sarsaparilla-Hemidesmus-indicus-nannari-plant.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-VWefboWumNM/UFn4oyK3qDI/AAAAAAAASd8/cxJJhLQs0pM/s1600/Indian-Sarsaparilla-Hemidesmus-indicus-nannari-plant.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As children we used to\nplay football, cricket and 7 tiles ( chatti ) , as soon as we came back from school, till\ndusk. During the holidays we used to play throughout the day. We were a gang of about 16 boys.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the summer\nvacations, invariably there would be a exhibition ( fair ) in Calicut. One of my\nfriends ( 13 years old ) used to have his own lemonade stall, like Dennis the\nMenace.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His elder brother and\nmother used to make Sarasaparilla sherbet concentrate for him. And we used to\nwatch.&nbsp; In Kerala everybody loves to have\nNannari spiked lemonade in summer. So this stall used to do roaring business.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rV9igTQNkOc/UFn79zXJtEI/AAAAAAAASeU/UCqwV3ThMeg/s1600/ffff.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-rV9igTQNkOc/UFn79zXJtEI/AAAAAAAASeU/UCqwV3ThMeg/s1600/ffff.jpg\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is how they\nprepared it--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Method:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1) Break the Nannari\nroots into say 5 cm long pieces and then dry them under the hot sun for about 5\nhours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3) Crush the roots with\na ammi and remove the hard portion from the inside of the root.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3) Powder the remaining\nparts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4) Boil water in a\nvessel. Once it boils, remove the vessel from the fire and now add the powdered\nroot and mix well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5) Leave the mixture\naside for 12 hours, without stirring--it has to diffuse.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6) Strain the liquid\nout with a muslin cloth into another vessel.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7) Add brown sugar into\nthe mixture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8) Place the mixture\nonto the stove again and boil till the texture become a bit sticky.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">8) Let it cool, now\nbottle it<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">9) Add fresh lemon\njuice to a table spoon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">10) Put crushed ice and\nthe lovely aroma ( woody + vanilla + fruity ) drink is ready to be served.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sarsaparilla is called\nAnantamul in Sanskrit. &nbsp;6000 year old\nAyurveda uses Sarsaparilla root extensively as it is an anti-oxidant and has\nquantum healing effects.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is\nadministered in the form of powder, infusion or decoction as syrup.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is also\na major component of several Ayurvedic medicinal preparations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sarsaparilla\n(Hemidesmus indicus) is a woody wine that can grow up to a height of 50 m and\nbears small flowers and black, blue or red berry-like fruits.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The exposed part of the\nroot is brown in colour, while the inner part is whitish. The root has an\nastringent taste and a pleasant odour. The herb is found in foothills and only\nthe roots of the herb are used for extraction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decoction of stalks and\nleaves is used for skin eruptions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decoction of the roots ( which contain vitamins A, B-complex, C and D, also the minerals iron,\nmanganese, sodium, silicon, sulfur, copper, Zinc, and iodine) , have several uses\nin the treatment of several disorders :--( in random order )&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Diuretic , to\nincrease the excretion of uric acid,increases volume of urine and flushes out\nstones from body<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coolant,&nbsp; promotes sweating , binding with toxins in\nthe skin and the sweating then pushes the toxins from the body through the skin\npores---</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">let me rush through now--</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">lood purifier---a</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">nti-inflammatory---&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">arthritis--- edema--- rheumatism---- kidney---- liver cleansers---- treating kidney stones---- &nbsp;venereal diseases---- epilepsy---- nervous\ndiseases---- tonsillitis---- syphillis---- stomach disorders---- lose weight---- &nbsp;constipation ---- alleviate inflammation of\nspleen and gall bladder---- urinary disorders---- anaemia---- &nbsp;wheezing---- infertility----impotence----.diarrhoea----acidity---- &nbsp;tonsillitis----antipyretic----, astringent to bowels----.urino-genital----tract\ninflammation----.gout---- epilepsy---- insanity---- chronic nervous diseases---- intestinal\ngas---- production of sexual hormones---- antibacterial activity---- .sore mouths of children---- lack of&nbsp; appetite----bronchitis----asthma---- ulcers---- body\nodour---- mouth odour---- piles---- uterine complaints---- paralysis---- premature graying of\nhairs---- eye and catarrhal problems---- scrofula and ringworms---- abdominal\ndistention---- turbid urine---- &nbsp;pre and\npost-natal care---- PMS---- immuno suppressant tonic---- eczema---- psoriasis----stimulates\nthe flow of bile---- &nbsp;good for hair growth---- stimulates the production of sexual hormones etc</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">SURPRISED? &nbsp;THIS IS ALL ABUT QUANTUM CATALYTIC ACTION !!..</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leprosy can be\ncontrolled by regular intake of the root powder in dose of 3 to 6 gms twice\ndaily along with decoction of this plant.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The juice of the roots can be applied\nas eye drops for burning sensation of the eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The root powder can\nalso be administered for dysentry, leucoderma and piles etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Negates the fatal\neffects of a phospholipase A2, which is one of the major components of venom\nreleased by cobra, krait and Russell\u2019s viper snakes.--also for treatment of\nscorpion stings and rat bites.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A saponin from the\nplant is found to have antiinflammatory activity against formalin induced\nedema.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tOa6sqwJyII/UFn5KLEqagI/AAAAAAAASeE/2aihSNQXRjk/s1600/Nannari.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"230\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-tOa6sqwJyII/UFn5KLEqagI/AAAAAAAASeE/2aihSNQXRjk/s320/Nannari.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A safe natural and\norganic drink, as an&nbsp; alternative to\nthirst quenching modern canned drinks that contains toxic and acidic chemicals. The Chinese Admiral Zheng He used to love it.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">Indian Sarasaparilla or Nannari, is different from American Sarsaparilla which they use in root beer.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nXwoEJRiq5Q/UFn6p8b8v7I/AAAAAAAASeM/CPAw5cs7108/s1600/me.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"307\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-nXwoEJRiq5Q/UFn6p8b8v7I/AAAAAAAASeM/CPAw5cs7108/s320/me.jpg\" width=\"320\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: large;\">I will advise Chilean wine makers to use Sarsaparilla as a flavour--to make it an elexir .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Never confuse taste\nwith flavour. &nbsp;Taste is a chemical sense\nperceived by the receptor cells in the taste buds. Flavour is a fusion of\nmultiple senses. &nbsp;Your perception of\nscent is more than a thousand times stronger than your perception of taste.\nTaste is 78% smell.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Grace and peace!</span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
