line-height: 150%;\">CAPT AJIT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">..</span></div>\n</div>\n", "author": {"id": "14410812789424637654", "displayName": "Capt. Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "76", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/5388887655341987448/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "7579780759506695612", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2012-09-15T16:23:00+05:30", "updated": "2014-03-03T21:43:48+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxMzkzODYzMjI4MTUzCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/09/an-officer-and-gentlemen-karl-von.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/7579780759506695612", "title": "AN OFFICER AND A GENTLEMEN, KARL VON  MULLER , CAPTAIN OF SMS EMDEN--- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WOH220A-w7E/UFRRU23ZXWI/AAAAAAAAR4s/m-jGKr-JyWo/s1600/SMS_Emden.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-WOH220A-w7E/UFRRU23ZXWI/AAAAAAAAR4s/m-jGKr-JyWo/s400/SMS_Emden.jpg\" height=\"416\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE NOBLE AND HONOURABLE &nbsp;KARL VON &nbsp;MULLER , CAPTAIN OF SMS EMDEN </span></b>--- CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<object class=\"BLOGGER-youtube-video\" classid=\"clsid:D27CDB6E-AE6D-11cf-96B8-444553540000\" codebase=\"http://download.macromedia.com/pub/shockwave/cabs/flash/swflash.cab#version=6,0,40,0\" data-thumbnail-src=\"http://1.gvt0.com/vi/JmvTrlgVB8k/0.jpg\" height=\"266\" width=\"320\"><param name=\"movie\" value=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/JmvTrlgVB8k&fs=1&source=uds\" /><param name=\"bgcolor\" value=\"#FFFFFF\" /><param name=\"allowFullScreen\" value=\"true\" /><embed width=\"320\" height=\"266\"  src=\"http://www.youtube.com/v/JmvTrlgVB8k&fs=1&source=uds\" type=\"application/x-shockwave-flash\" allowfullscreen=\"true\"></embed></object></div>\n<br />\n<br />\nFirst play the video above-- to get the feel about what follows-- this is a story which beats PAPILLON by miles.<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a true story. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\">Leave the music of the video running, as you read this long post.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RsyxwNUrjZU/UFRna4vCZMI/AAAAAAAAR-k/s_gejNrebK8/s1600/WWFGVCX.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RsyxwNUrjZU/UFRna4vCZMI/AAAAAAAAR-k/s_gejNrebK8/s400/WWFGVCX.jpg\" height=\"400\" width=\"278\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the amazing\nheart warming story of a German naval ship Captain of SMS.Emden, Capt Karl Von Muller, the greatest\nwartime sea Captain EVER, renowned for his daring valor and chivalry to the\nlosers, during the First World War.. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nMfK0NWU4ds/UFRX0RM9XvI/AAAAAAAAR70/04N4mLhYmGI/s1600/emden_muller.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-nMfK0NWU4ds/UFRX0RM9XvI/AAAAAAAAR70/04N4mLhYmGI/s320/emden_muller.jpg\" height=\"258\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Probably the Captain of\nthe<span style=\"color: red;\"> German ship Graf Spee, Capt Hans Wilhelm Langsdorff</span> , of the Second World\nWar, will come a close second.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These honorable and\nresourceful men knew the meaning of \"bravery without brutality\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All the while surviving\non coal and provisions seized from enemy ships, the Emden delayed troop\nmovements, sank two warships, held up twenty-one British merchantmen, sending\nsixteen to the bottom, abducted four colliers, shelled Madras, causing a huge\noil fire, and made a daring hit-and-run raid on Penang.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Capt M\u00fcller's valor and noble spirit &nbsp;was instantly recognized not only in Germany and among neutral nations but also by the\nBritish themselves, who regarded him as the quintessence of \"the gallant\nenemy.\" His ship swiftly turned into a legend whose aura was enhanced by\nthe courtesy and fortitude of its crew to those they captured and by their\nskill in military piracy.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">When the Emden was finally over-whelmed by the&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif;\"><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">insurmountable</span></span><span style=\"font-family: Times New Roman, serif; font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;odds against her, the whole world including allied newspaper and media expressed relief that gallant Capt M\u00fcller had survived!</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is in stark\ncontrast to the evil soldiers of the post world wars, who kill thousands of\nchildren from a safe distance, so that they can have \"their way of\nlife\".<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are the type of\npeople the victors of these world wars have painted black. History will be\nre-written in this Internet age. It is the right of the world citizen to know\nthe truth.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flames of the First\nWorld War was fanned by Winston Churchill ( whose mother Jennie Jerome )\nbelonged to the Jewish Rothschild family-- hell bent on creating a state of\nIsrael in Palestine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Let me start from the\nbeginning--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SMS Emden , the most\nfeared ship on this planet, could hold 400 sailors , and had a length of 118\nmetres with a top speed of 23 knots ( about 43 kms/ hr ) .&nbsp; She was the last German cruiser to use\nreciprocating engines, with steam .&nbsp;\nEmden's twelve boilers were heated by burning coal.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emden raided\nAllied shipping in the Indian Ocean early in the war, sinking or capturing\nthirty Allied merchant vessels and warships.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emden left Kiel on 12\nApril 1910, transited the Kiel Canal, and entered the open sea.</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">She was not destined</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp; </span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">to see fatherland Germany ever again. She\nacquired the nickname \"Swan of the East\" because of her graceful\nlines.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In May 1913, Emden\nreceived her last commanding officer, Korvettenkapit\u00e4n Karl von M\u00fcller-- a\nquiet and enigmatic soul.&nbsp; The grace and\nchivalry of Captain von M\u00fcller during his command would earn him the respect of\nboth friend and foe. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt Muller monitored\nthe radio daily. On 29 June 1914, word came that Archduke Ferdinand of Austria\nhad been assassinated by a Serbian. He was perceptive enough to feel that&nbsp; a major world war was brewing, with Churchill\nas the First Lord of British Admiralty working as a&nbsp; Rothschild stooge.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, when news came from\nEurope that WW1 was imminent, he, did not want to be boxed up in harbor , and\nimmediately took capacity bunkers of coal. He was determined not to let history\nrepeat itself.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-D_ew4IdsakU/UFRWOG5VzzI/AAAAAAAAR68/q3ZKmKY7P04/s1600/imagesIYREEE.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-D_ew4IdsakU/UFRWOG5VzzI/AAAAAAAAR68/q3ZKmKY7P04/s400/imagesIYREEE.jpg\" height=\"467\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He slipped out of&nbsp; Tsingtao on 31 July 1914 and was at sea , as\nsoon as news of the beginning of World War I was received on 2 August 1914.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 4 August, the\nlookout of Emden spotted a merchant vessel's stern running light. After twelve\nshots across her bow, the Russian vessel Rjasan stopped for the Emden's search\nparty. Capt Muller was told that there were a lot of frightened female Indian Hindu passengers aboard. Chivalry forced him to return back to Tsingtao escorting the\nRussian ship.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vEb7fpg1O-s/UFRUnQAN8nI/AAAAAAAAR6M/OBXAg-6xPus/s1600/RJASEN+RUSSIAN+SHIP.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vEb7fpg1O-s/UFRUnQAN8nI/AAAAAAAAR6M/OBXAg-6xPus/s400/RJASEN+RUSSIAN+SHIP.jpg\" height=\"467\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller,\nrevealed a daring plan to the German Admiral Von Spee, to leave one light\ncruiser in the Far East to prey on the enemy's commerce, and so divert\nattention from Spee's escaping fleet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller\nhimself would take the Emden into the Indian Ocean to maintain German presence,\nand do his bit to add glory of the Fatherland. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Taking along the\ncollier Markomannia \"with a full load of first-class coal,\" the Emden\ndetached from the fleet on 14 August 1914.&nbsp;\nIn 1914, the Indian Ocean was frequently referred to as a \"British\nlake\" because of British domination of the surrounding ports .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt M\u00fcller built a\ndummy fourth smokestack on the ship\u2019s superstructure to resemble the British\ncruiser HMS Yarmouth.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-uZHDmi2koS4/UFRY2Yv-DUI/AAAAAAAAR8c/oPw1e7qih3w/s1600/HMAS_Sydney.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-uZHDmi2koS4/UFRY2Yv-DUI/AAAAAAAAR8c/oPw1e7qih3w/s400/HMAS_Sydney.jpg\" height=\"363\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 28 August 1914, Emden then slipped through the narrow\nstrait between Bali and Lombok into the Indian Ocean, her collier several miles\nastern in her wake.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On 10 September, the\nEmden began to prey upon the hundreds of unescorted British and Allied merchant\nships. Most of the captured British ships were quickly sunk, either by fire\nfrom Emden's guns or by placing explosive charges deep in their hulls. Captain\nM\u00fcller was always gentlemanly to the captains and passengers of the ships he\ncaptured, and he made certain that every captured British sailor was treated\nwell and kept safe.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The British Admiralty\ndid not learn of the Emden's presence until 14 September, at which time it\nstopped all British shipping on the Colombo-Singapore route. This caused panic\namong the British and Allied shipping offices in the Indian Ocean. Insurance\nrates for merchant ships skyrocketed, shipping companies could not afford to\nleave harbour. It was a source of much embarrassment to the British and other\nAllies that a single German cruiser could effectively shut down the entire\nIndian Ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Several warships from\nthe British Australian and Far East squadrons, as well as a few French,\nJapanese and Russian cruisers, were dispatched to hunt down the Emden, but von\nM\u00fcller eluded them all.&nbsp; Some captains of\nBritish merchant ships, seeing the Emden approach, would salute her, mistaking\nher for the Yarmouth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Instead, the Emden would fire a shot over the bow, hoist\nthe German naval ensign, and signal \"stop at once \u2013 do not wireless.\"\nAnd even if the enemy Captain did wireless, disregarding express orders to the contrary, Capt Muller\ndid NOT allow retribution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the night of 22\nSeptember 1914, SMS Emden quietly approached the city of Madras. &nbsp;There was some Hindu festival going on , as the lights were bright.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dV1OphvzDEc/UFRR6121dGI/AAAAAAAAR48/N-7HYLb4Ffw/s1600/21_Aug_thasr_Emden_1185338g.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-dV1OphvzDEc/UFRR6121dGI/AAAAAAAAR48/N-7HYLb4Ffw/s400/21_Aug_thasr_Emden_1185338g.jpg\" height=\"577\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After entering\nthe Madras harbor area and observing for a moment with his searchlights,( taking\nhelp from an Indian doctor Chempakaraman Pillai on board.)--</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-UtlpBfbU0ok/UFRUROHAdRI/AAAAAAAAR58/nBVFXNr817U/s1600/imagesFGHK.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-UtlpBfbU0ok/UFRUROHAdRI/AAAAAAAAR58/nBVFXNr817U/s320/imagesFGHK.jpg\" height=\"260\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M\u00fcller gave the order to engage at 9:30\npm, Emden opened fire at 3000 yards on the several large oil tanks within the\nharbor which belonged to the Burmah Oil Company.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mFwwA7ohFRU/UFRSP4qTv5I/AAAAAAAAR5E/9ASt2I2P9yg/s1600/DDD.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-mFwwA7ohFRU/UFRSP4qTv5I/AAAAAAAAR5E/9ASt2I2P9yg/s400/DDD.jpg\" height=\"369\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Within the first 30 rounds,\nthe oil tanks were in flames.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZaN5t1U8OUI/UFVVkk3SZcI/AAAAAAAASBs/1VisF8jJJss/s1600/135257561_-_08_08__1185015g.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZaN5t1U8OUI/UFVVkk3SZcI/AAAAAAAASBs/1VisF8jJJss/s400/135257561_-_08_08__1185015g.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"569\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The action lasted half an hour, until 10:00 pm,\nby which time the British shore batteries had begun to respond.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9TIZEDBleas/UFRXTJ1T3hI/AAAAAAAAR7k/JryocekSaic/s1600/DSC06162HIGH+COURT+WALL+MADRAS.JPG\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-9TIZEDBleas/UFRXTJ1T3hI/AAAAAAAAR7k/JryocekSaic/s320/DSC06162HIGH+COURT+WALL+MADRAS.JPG\" height=\"300\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, Emden\nslipped away unscathed. In all, 125 shells were fired by the Germans., it was a\nsevere blow to British morale and thousands of people fled the city.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xBM-18ZBBzk/UFRSW-unKmI/AAAAAAAAR5M/CtlzrL8Qy6A/s1600/SSS.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-xBM-18ZBBzk/UFRSW-unKmI/AAAAAAAAR5M/CtlzrL8Qy6A/s400/SSS.jpg\" height=\"456\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Madras was\nthe only Indian city to come under attack by forces of the axis Powers during\nWorld War .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kWtNO_chh14/UFRS9hDs8hI/AAAAAAAAR5U/XzRuryA37sE/s1600/madras.JPG.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-kWtNO_chh14/UFRS9hDs8hI/AAAAAAAAR5U/XzRuryA37sE/s320/madras.JPG.jpg\" height=\"265\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emden then sailed\nsouth coasting the east coast of Ceylon. He took in some meat and fresh\nprovisions for his crew off Trincomalee .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">M\u00fcller then steered\ntowards Minicoy in the Laccadive Islands, where, between 25 and 29 September\n1914, he sank six more Allied ships. &nbsp; HMS\nHampshire and the Chikuma, of the Imperial Japanese Navy were frantically\nsearching for Emden in the Laccadive Sea. &nbsp;They were, however, unsuccessful, as\ntheir elusive prey had, by the time they arrived, slipped away to the Maldives.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt Muller to the ship to Diego Garcia and dropped the anchor on 5 October. He then spent the next ten days having the ship's keel cleaned\noff barnacles which was reducing the speed and causing excess coal consumption.\nHe gave his crew some morale boosting shore leave.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He overhauled his guns and machinery and got\nready for further action. Emden went back to Laccadive Sea area around Minicoy,\nand bagged ten Allied ships. The world Allied shipping was again suspended. 72\nallied Naval ships were pressed into action to deal with one single raider ship,&nbsp; by a fuming Churchill.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On October 18, M\u00fcller\nstopped the Blue Funnel steamer Troilus on its maiden voyage from China to\nRotterdam with a cargo of rubber, copper, and tin. Troilus proved to be the\nraider's most valuable prize, but Emden now carried so many prisoners that when\nit captured yet another British freighter, St. Egbert. Capt M\u00fcller chose not to\ndestroy it but to use it as a means of getting rid of his prisoners.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the morning of 21\nOctober 1914, Emden set course for the Nicobar Islands, where he coaled for\ngreater strike range.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Off Ceylon, Emden again\nfound good hunting. &nbsp;In the last days of September the raider captured six\nprizes, including a collier, Buresk, filled with high-quality Welsh coal. &nbsp;The crew of Buresk would scuttle their own ship, later.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the Nicobars, Captain M\u00fcller set sail for the British port\nof Penang in British Malaya. On the morning of 28 October 1914, Emden entered the\nharbour at top speed, still disguised as a British cruiser with the fake fourth\nsmokestack.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During what became known as the Battle of Penang, she raised the\nGerman flag once inside the harbour and launched a torpedo at the Zhemchug, a\nveteran of the Battle of Tsushima, followed by a salvo of shells which riddled the\nRussian ship.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A second torpedo, fired as the Emden turned to leave, penetrated\nthe forward magazine, causing an explosion that sank the ship. &nbsp;The captain of\nthe Zhemchug Baron Cherkassov was ashore at the Eastern and Oriental Hotel, Georgetown, &nbsp;having a <i>tete e tete </i>with his mistress during the attack. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The poor Captain got a bird's eye view of the whole fireworks from his hotel balcony and with a sinking heart. What could be worse for a ship Captain? &nbsp; He was\nsubsequently demoted , stripped off his nobility and imprisoned for 3.5 years. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-eKNp8VIwLGg/UFdwOp5_TvI/AAAAAAAASJ8/31AZSYHd57k/s1600/rrtyu.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-eKNp8VIwLGg/UFdwOp5_TvI/AAAAAAAASJ8/31AZSYHd57k/s400/rrtyu.jpg\" height=\"364\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They keys of the magazine were ashore taken by an Officer to a bordello for safekeeping . A party of sixty Chinese prostitutes were on aboard at the time of the attack and the crew were busy doing<i> <span style=\"color: blue;\"><b>jigi-jigi ! </b></span></i><b style=\"color: blue;\">. &nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The toll? &nbsp;89 killed 143 wounded.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DvimZm0Bygo/UFdw0tSj-dI/AAAAAAAASKE/1dyskPw_p9w/s1600/dddr.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-DvimZm0Bygo/UFdw0tSj-dI/AAAAAAAASKE/1dyskPw_p9w/s400/dddr.jpg\" height=\"478\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As quickly as Emden had\narrived, she turned around and made good her escape. The French destroyer\nMousquet chased Emden. Once out to sea, the Emden turned on the lone French\ndestroyer and opened fire,&nbsp; quickly\nsinking her. Her sister ships, Pistolet and Fronde were in hot pursuit too ,\nbut soon lost contact.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thirty-six French\nsurvivors from Mousquet were rescued by Emden, and when three died of their\ninjuries, they were buried at sea with full honours. Two days later, the\nremaining Frenchmen were transferred to a British steamer, Newburn, which had\nbeen stopped by the German ship, but not attacked, so as to enable them to be\ntransported to Sabang, Sumatra, in the neutral Dutch East Indies. The French\nsailors were safely ashore the following day, the grateful British captain&nbsp; mailed a thank you letter to Captain M\u00fcller.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In this period, Emden\nwas arguably the most hunted ship in the world, and yet M\u00fcller managed to elude\nthe combined efforts of highly capable battleships , the Japanese cruisers\nYahaghi and Chikuma, the Russian Askold and the British Hampshire and Yarmouth HMS\nGloucester, HMS Weymouth,RMS Empress of Russia and SS Empress of Australia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Germans treated them\nwith courtesy. The master of one prize told newsmen: \"The German officers\nwere very polite. I may say extraordinarily polite. Before we left\u2026for Colombo,\nthey all wished us a pleasant journey.\"</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von M\u00fcller now\ntook his ship through the Sunda Strait towards the Cocos Islands, where he\nplanned to destroy the Eastern Telegraph Company wireless station at Direction\nIsland, thereby crippling Allied communication in the Indian Ocean.&nbsp; This station was co-ordinating the attack on\nhis ship, using sighting reports .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From there he aimed to make for Socotra and\nraid Allied merchant shipping on the Bombay-Aden route. However, this was not\nto be.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">72 Allied warships were\nfrantically combing the Indian Ocean in the search for the Emden .&nbsp;</span><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Emden had sunk or captured 30 Allied ships, and totally disrupted Allied shipping in the Indian Ocean over a period of three months.</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">In London the first lord of the Admiralty, Winston Churchill, frothed from his mouth, got roaring drunk with an inserted Opium suppository for good measure, &nbsp;and</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">fired off a passionate memo <i><span style=\"color: red;\">\"The escape of the Emden from the Bay of Bengal is most unsatisfactory, and I do not understand on what principle the operations of the four cruisers Hampshire, Yarmouth, Dupleix and Chikuma have been concerted\u2026.Who is the senior captain of these four ships? Is he a good man? If so, he should be told to hoist a commodore's broad pennant and take command of the squadron which\u2026should devote itself exclusively to hunting the Emden.\"</span></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-p87__20C-jM/UFRTJufJp9I/AAAAAAAAR5c/PPqpanzYU4c/s1600/map_1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-p87__20C-jM/UFRTJufJp9I/AAAAAAAAR5c/PPqpanzYU4c/s400/map_1.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"579\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">She reached\nDirection Island on 9 November 1914.&nbsp;\nM\u00fcller decided to send a landing party ashore under First Lieutenant\nHelmuth von M\u00fccke to destroy the station's radio tower and equipment. Fifty\nseamen with rifles and machine guns were sent ashore. The British civilians,\naware of the gallant conduct of the Emden's captain and crew, did not resist.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emden's landing party even agreed not to knock the radio tower down over\nthe island's tennis court.&nbsp; But in the\nextra time spent to facilitate this request , they double crossed the Germans\nand shot off a ham message . It was too late , and personal retribution was not\nthe Emden style.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Australian light\ncruiser HMAS Sydney, was dispatched to reach Direction Island at 9 th Nov 1919\nat 0630 hours&nbsp;&nbsp; from an Australian troop\nconvoy en route to Colombo. Being a mere 55 miles north of the Island, she\narrived there in about two hours.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nShortly after 9 a.m., the lookout of Emden reported a ship to the\nnorth. They recognized the four funnels, and the Germans knew they\nwere in trouble.<br />\n<br />\nM\u00fcller signaled frantically for the shore party to return.\nWhen it was slow to respond, the raider cast of the collier Buresk, raised anchor and steamed out of the\nharbor at about 9:30 AM to&nbsp;<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">engage the\nAustralian cruiser.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThe larger and stronger armoured Australian light cruiser, HMAS Sydney was commanded by\nCaptain John Glossop. Sydney had longer range and better guns and could do 3\nknots more than Emden.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Emden could neither outfight its opponent nor escape. Capt Muller</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;realised that he was\nout-gunned and that he did not have the option to flee.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">His only hope of\nsurvival lay in getting close enough to the enemy to mount a torpedo attack.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller's\ntactic of approaching the Sydney at full speed and firing everything he had at\nher, until he was close enough to launch torpedoos, was to no avail. Captain\nGlossop used his ship's superior speed to hold off from the Emden and let his\ngunners do their work.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThe fight went on for nearly an hour and a half., &nbsp;Emden herself suffered serious damage, being\nstruck over 100 times by shells from Sydney. Emden's main gunners were ashore on the island.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nThe ventilation blowers were knocked out, along with the steering gear and the bridge telegraph. Capt Muller still tried his best to manoevere by using his twin screws. The guns could not get ammunition.<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-M7PhxCcKd7M/UFRTWYcyUGI/AAAAAAAAR5k/df0AaLuX3bU/s1600/Last_Battle-of_SMS_Emden_a.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-M7PhxCcKd7M/UFRTWYcyUGI/AAAAAAAAR5k/df0AaLuX3bU/s400/Last_Battle-of_SMS_Emden_a.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"432\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller,\nunable to bring his torpedoes to bear, his ship a veritable slaughter-house,\nand his guns impotent, forced himself to order the ship run aground on be\nclosest reef off North Keeling Island so that the wounded might live without\ndrowning.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-pJaJeM2kwaE/UFRUEr2piRI/AAAAAAAAR50/Q39T92fNheg/s1600/imagesffgg.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-pJaJeM2kwaE/UFRUEr2piRI/AAAAAAAAR50/Q39T92fNheg/s400/imagesffgg.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"414\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emden was now incapable of fighting, and lay a helpless wreck on\na coral reef, heavily listed to port , at 1115 AM on 9th Nov 1914..</span></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5JnWB8TpTCs/UFRWemKGrOI/AAAAAAAAR7E/jfehh_Kp4qY/s1600/imagesgre43w.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-5JnWB8TpTCs/UFRWemKGrOI/AAAAAAAAR7E/jfehh_Kp4qY/s400/imagesgre43w.jpg\" height=\"424\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At this point, Sydney left the scene to pursue\nthe collier Buresk , which had just cast off from Emden while bunkering at anchor.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Germans aboard the\nBuresk stared in consternation at the charging Sydney, and at the smoking,\nfireblackened hulk that had once been the silvery Emden. &nbsp;They could cheat the\nBritish out of the pleasure of recovering a war prize. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, even as the\nBritish ordered them to surrender, they were busy scuttling the Buresk.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The small arms were\nthrown overboard, the secret papers burnt, and the wireless station destroyed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Meanwhile two boats were cleared and provisioned for the the remaining crew in\ncase the Sydney showed her mean ness and&nbsp;\nrefused to take the Buresk's crew aboard her. Thus, Capt Glossep found himself\nwith a few mangy lifeboats in tow instead of a war prize. &nbsp;This took away some of his\nglow, and it was said that he cursed and swore on the bridhe , at the Germans for their trick . &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He could\nNOT fire as the Buresk communicated that they had British cooks on board.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Churchill got roaring\ndrunk again with a Opium suppository up inside, and ordered that no mercy shall be given to Emden.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Returning at 1630 hours\nto the beached cruiser, Sydney's commander, Captain John Glossop, in a most\ndisgraceful and foul manner , re-opened fire, taking out all his personal pent up frustrations on Capt Muller. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This type of mean\nKangaroo down under retribution style ( raping the dead and wounded ) would be\nrepeated again in the Second World War.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nPunch into Google search <b><span style=\"color: red;\">NO GLORY AND HONOUR , SINKING OF BISMARK-\nVADAKAYIL. </span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yes, this is true. Till\nnow you have been reading victors version of history and kangaroo court\nverdicts,&nbsp; right? Punch into Google\nsearch <span style=\"color: blue;\">RUDOLF HESS , A HONOURABLE MAN- VADAKAYIL.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fires and dead men were\neverywhere, and the crackle of the devouring flames was only-matched by the\nanguished cries of the bloodied wounded, the maimed with bones protruding , and\nthe dying.&nbsp; The decks were awash with\nblood. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt Glossop did NOT\nallow his conscience to overtake his criminal DNA and&nbsp; mean nature, as he ordered salvo after salvo\non to the totally disabled and listed Emden at 4 PM.&nbsp;&nbsp; 2/3 of Emden was lying on the reef, and\nthere was no way she could shoot back.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As salvo after salvo\nhit, the firmly grounded Emden was reduced to a blitzed and twisted mass of blazing metal .</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sydney had always shot at Emden from \" beyond Emden guns range \" -- even if Emden wanted to shoot back there was NO way this could be done. &nbsp; Only a torpedo from Emden meant any danger to Sydney, and this could NOT be done in this grounded position , as was obvious to even a child.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-op3_HVbBeso/UFRTqP5Z0RI/AAAAAAAAR5s/C2w9IMoDJA0/s1600/wrekage+after+the+battle.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-op3_HVbBeso/UFRTqP5Z0RI/AAAAAAAAR5s/C2w9IMoDJA0/s400/wrekage+after+the+battle.jpg\" height=\"640\" width=\"392\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Finally, as\nan Aussie sailor on Sydney noted later \"The mutilation of the dead and\nsplattered blood and bone fragments was beyond belief.\"<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">War criminal Capt Glossop's own men on\nSydney were glaring at him accusingly, at this ( Churchill initiated )&nbsp;</span></span><span style=\"line-height: 24px;\">heinous</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;war crime\nwith white faces.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></span></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;;\"><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><span style=\"line-height: 150%;\">Some young sailors\nwere crying .<o:p></o:p></span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt Von Muller noted\nthat he did NOT have a flag mast , as the area was burning, and quickly arranged a white hospital bedsheet\nto flutter.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Sydney then instead of\nattending to the wounded on Emden as per seagoing traditions and code of\nconduct in war, steamed to Direction Island to check out the wireless\nequipment. What a disgrace.</span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He then decided to lay\noff and approach Emden the next afternoon at 1300 hrs on 10 th Oct 1914.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller\ntried to organize the survivors into rescue parties so that the wounded could\nbe brought up on deck for transfer to the island. In rough weather the breeched\nbuoy broke. He gave permission to everyone on deck to swim to the island.\nDuring that night Surgeon Schwabe, who had swum to land, succumbed to his\nwounds<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: lime;\">After a disgraceful\ndelay of 21 hours, where in wounded men on Emden either bled to death or\ndeveloped gangrene</span>,&nbsp; the Aussie Captain\nand crew of Sydney after a hearty breakfast and lunch came back and sent two\nboats with an officer to the Emden with the information that the commander of\nthe Sydney was ready to take aboard the survivors of the Emden's crew.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At high\nwater Emden was flooded to within two feet of the upper deck and waves were\ncrashing on deck, washing away the diffusion from the caked red blood.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Glossop later said that\nhe \"felt like a murderer\" for ordering the last salvoes, but had no\nchoice under the circumstances. Even today the BULLSHIT history written by the victors state that Sydney went hunting for the Buresk, and then it was too dark to approach Emden with boats.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emden lost 134\nkilled and 65 severely wounded. The Sydney lost 4 killed and 12 wounded.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The boarding survivor\nGermans did not moan, nor whimper nor malinger. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Captain von Muller was\nthe last to leave as was proper for the commanding officer of a defeated\nvessel. Meanwhile he made sure that the guns were made unserviceable by\nthrowing overboard the breech-blocks and destroying the sights, the\ntorpedo-director was thrown overboard, and all the secret papers that had not\nbeen already burnt were destroyed. He ordered fires to be drawn in all boilers,\nand all the engine and boiler rooms to be flooded.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zPFZgiLUNnY/UFRXda3v0lI/AAAAAAAAR7s/rQFmnmw4EaA/s1600/378255afe5e354d0eba74fd5b24a777ddb023f70.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-zPFZgiLUNnY/UFRXda3v0lI/AAAAAAAAR7s/rQFmnmw4EaA/s320/378255afe5e354d0eba74fd5b24a777ddb023f70.png\" height=\"640\" width=\"513\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt von Muller then\nresigned himself to waiting aboard the wreck until the Sydney returned. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Historians Writer and\nSellick record the extraordinary scene when von Muller, with a guard of honour,\nwas piped aboard the Sydney: <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Capt John CT Glossop greeted\nhim on the gangway, shook his adversary's hand firmly, he would not meet Capt\nMuller\u2019s steely eyes. &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lXBni4yk2rQ/UFVL4xYcrpI/AAAAAAAASAM/apKMm5b8nFg/s1600/dddde.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-lXBni4yk2rQ/UFVL4xYcrpI/AAAAAAAASAM/apKMm5b8nFg/s400/dddde.jpg\" height=\"320\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a gesture of conscience that made every onlooking eye moist,\nCapt Glossop suddenly put his arm around Capt von Muller's shoulder, and led\nhim to his own cabin. &nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: 'Times New Roman', serif; font-size: 16px; line-height: 150%;\">He proved that he was human and NOT an animal.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The surviving German\ncrew, were transferred to the SS Empress of Russia and taken to Colombo<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Emden remained\naground on North Keeling Island until 1960 when a Japanese scrap metal company\nsalvaged the metal from the vessel.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Kj0VwgJ42yk/UFRWz8LlaxI/AAAAAAAAR7U/y5Pr9iT3Bjg/s1600/CVBBN.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://3.bp.blogspot.com/-Kj0VwgJ42yk/UFRWz8LlaxI/AAAAAAAAR7U/y5Pr9iT3Bjg/s400/CVBBN.jpg\" height=\"395\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The remains have slipped back down the\nreef, where they now lie in 8 metres of water.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I2lPN6gtyWs/UFRWqnxDkcI/AAAAAAAAR7M/Hxatqe7KQPw/s1600/imagesfeeee.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-I2lPN6gtyWs/UFRWqnxDkcI/AAAAAAAAR7M/Hxatqe7KQPw/s400/imagesfeeee.jpg\" height=\"457\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Today the remains of\nEmden has been declared an historic shipwreck.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><span style=\"color: red;\">A few years ago I touched the gun of Emden erected at the southeastern\ncorner of Hyde Park in the city of Sydney--below . I guess it altered my DNA programming a bit. &nbsp;A police officer looked on--he did NOT stop me.</span></i><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; line-height: 150%; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QVB8FynP93k/UFRVNR77h9I/AAAAAAAAR6c/1ckiwseMVPk/s1600/hmas_sydney_memorial_pfw_a+(1).jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-QVB8FynP93k/UFRVNR77h9I/AAAAAAAAR6c/1ckiwseMVPk/s320/hmas_sydney_memorial_pfw_a+(1).jpg\" height=\"480\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On the 11th of\nNovember, after taking aboard the petty officers and men from North Keeling\nIsland, the Sydney proceeded to Colombo. On the 15th the Sydney reached\nColombo, where all the wounded were landed and placed in hospital, and all the\nother survivors of the Emden's crew were distributed among various steamers of\nthe convoy, to be taken to Malta.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>The island too has a\njuicy history.<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<i><br /></i></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>In 1814, a Scottish\nmerchant ship Captain named John Clunies-Ross stopped briefly at the islands\non a trip to India. He laid claim to the island by nailing up a Union Jack and planning to return and settle\non the islands with his family in the future.<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>However, a playboy Englishman named Alexander Hare had better plans. He hired a captain,\ncoincidentally Clunies-Ross' own brother, to bring him and a harem of forty young attractive Malay\nwomen to the islands where he hoped to set up his own private harem .&nbsp;</i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>When Clunies-Ross\nreturned two years later with his wife, children and mother-in-law in tow, and found\nHare already ensconsed on the island and living with a private harem, a feud\ngrew instantly between the two men. &nbsp;Clunies-Ross' eight virile sailors, \"began at\nonce the invasion of the new kingdom to take possession of it, women and\nall\".<o:p></o:p></i></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i><br /></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><i>After some time, Hare's\nwomen wanting some better quality and quantity in bed , began deserting him, and zoomed in on the young sailors, who needed no Viagra. &nbsp;Heart broken , our man Hare left the island; he died in Bencoolen\nin 1834. &nbsp;Hare , at your old age did you expect to chain the hearts of 40 young women?</i></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">This reminds me of a sailor's joke:</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">An old Captain who could NOT get a hop, decided to seek professional medical help. &nbsp;The doctor examined him. &nbsp;The wise doctor then sat down and rasped \" When you want a hop, all you need is to drink a lot of rusty water, and then hang a magnet around your neck!\"</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0o3xr_iCEHA/UFRU2EZ0lHI/AAAAAAAAR6U/b1hqrsylq8o/s1600/Cruise_of_the_Emden_1914_Map_0.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-0o3xr_iCEHA/UFRU2EZ0lHI/AAAAAAAAR6U/b1hqrsylq8o/s400/Cruise_of_the_Emden_1914_Map_0.png\" height=\"456\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\">Prize log of the Emden<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><b>Date (all 1914) / &nbsp; Belligerent ship&nbsp;/ &nbsp; &nbsp; Tonnage/ &nbsp; &nbsp;Flag/ &nbsp; &nbsp;Cargo &nbsp; /&nbsp; Fate</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><i>16 October &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;/Benmohr/ &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; 4,806/ &nbsp; British/ General&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Sunk<o:p></o:p></i></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: normal;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;,&quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt;\"><i>18 October &nbsp; &nbsp; / Fernando/ Poo&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Spanish/ &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;
