I did not make any attempt to run away; in fact I<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">never entertained any\nidea of running away. I did not try to shoot myself...<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">for, it was my ardent\ndesire to give vent to my thoughts in an open Court.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">My confidence about the\nmoral side of my action has not been shaken even by<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the criticism levelled\nof against it on all sides.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have no doubt, honest&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">writers of history will\nweigh my act and find the</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;true value thereof some&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">day in future. \"</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">I must explode a\nbombshell right now.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Chitapavan means \u201cfound\nlying at sea shore\u201d in colloquial Hindi.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Chitpavans of Maharashtra were a bunch of light eyed jews who ventured\nfrom Kerala northwards by ship and their ship sank in the NW monsoon off the\nKolaba district of Konkan .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The Y chromosome of\nChitpavan Brahmins , who were unknown before the 18th century, contains a Cohenim\nhaplotype unique to Jewish Rabbis.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">The Bene Israel claim\nthat they share a common origin with the Indian Jews Chitpavan Brahmins.&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><span style=\"color: blue;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">BR Ambedkar\u2019s wife was\na Chitpavan Brahmin.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"background-color: yellow; color: blue; font-size: large;\">Gopal Krishna\nGokhale the mentor of Gandhi was a Chitpavan.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">The assassin of Gandhi was a Chitpavan.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Mahadev Govind Ranade the mentor of Gokhale and the founding member of\nthe Indian National Congress was a Chitpavan.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Rothschild had their\nfake Western historians inject every where that Chitpavan Brahmins are\nexplained in the tall tale of Lord &nbsp;Parshuram in the Sahyadrikhanda of the Skanda\nPurana.<o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Hey, ring a bell?</span></b><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"http://2.bp.blogspot.com/-7h6w0w7HX84/U0e5cRVed8I/AAAAAAAArRU/UESlGL1bIlM/s1600/jan-smuts-on-the-timu65e-magazine-cover-22-may-1944.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Gandhi was created in\nSouth Africa by the Rothschild as the only brown skin leader who can make the\nmight British Empire bend , a tall leader who commands so much respect and awe that\neven Britannia who ruled the waves got into fog ,unable to navigate.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Gandhi was aggressively\npropped up and promoted by Christian missionaries and General Jan Christiaan\nSmuts, who bend every time he had a head on collision with Gandhi-giving all\nIndian coolies a terrific ego massage visavis Gandhi.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Nobody EVER &nbsp;heard of Gandhi before, neither in South\nAfrica nor in India. &nbsp;The constant arm\ntwisting of a powerful racist like Gen Smuts and extravagant concessions extracted\n&nbsp;by Gandhi spread his fame far and wide.\nAll this was a huge charade.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>When Gandhi arrived in\nIndia, the British government kept bowing before him in all his agitations and\nconceded what he had demanded. &nbsp;All this\ncannot be rare coincidence even to a duffer.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Gradually, Indians\nbegan to rally behind Gandhi as the \u201ctall leader who gets the work done.\u201d.<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>General Jan Christiaan\nSmuts was a Rothschild stooge for he was the only person to sign each of the\npeace treaties ending the First and Second World Wars, a war fought with the\nsole intention of carving out the state of Israel. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Gen Smuts was a field marshal in the British\nArmy in 1941, and served in the Imperial War Cabinet under Winston Churchill\nwhose mother is Rothschild . <o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>Today an Israeli town\nis named after Gen Jan Smuts, a man who was a close friend of Rothschild, and Lord\nBalfour..<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Gen Jan Christiaan\nSmuts bust was installed in 1949 in the &nbsp;Hebrew University of Jerusalem, in a ceremony\nattended by Gen Smuts &nbsp;Mr. Justice\nLeopold Greenberg and E.D. Goitein, the Israel minister.</b></span><span style=\"font-size: small;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; The word Thirazh muri which means an agenda approved in a meeting. Such a valid proof is available for Tamil Language.No other language has such a valid proof as Tamil has. Except Asokas script in India all other scripts are found during Guptas period only. In Asoka's script was not used to write Sanskrit. TEE HEEEE !<br />\n<br />\nIt is comprised of 1330 pairs each with exactly 7 words.<br />\n<br />\nThere are 133 chapters and 3 parts. The 3 main parts are:<br />\nAram (Dharma / Justice)<br />\nPorul (Artha / Wealth &amp; Power)<br />\nInbam (Kamam / Love &amp; Sex).<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nThe book on A\u1e5fam (virtue) contains 380 verses, that of Poru\u1e37 (wealth) has 700 and that of Inbam ( kama sex) has 250.<br />\nThere are two parts of Thirukkural's Kama<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2--<br />\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_164MN\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_164BR\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_164B_box\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_165B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8235661969138140139\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_165M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2018/05/henry-ford-victim-of-jewish-retribution_6.html?showComment=1525741329647#c8235661969138140139\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 8, 2018 at 6:32 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_165MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1--<br />\n<br />\nKalaviyal - This goes into a secret love (or pre-marital love or affair). There are plenty of tips on how to recognize the signs of love and how to impress the lover. It also goes into what it likes to miss a lover and how to embrace the right way.<br />\nInteresting quotes:<br />\nIt is difficult to understand<br />\nThe essence of the knight is the shoulder<br />\nThis girl has the elixir in her shoulders. Whenever I hug her, I get reborn.<br />\n<br />\nMedication for dysfunction<br />\nThe medicine itself is for self<br />\nThere is medicine for every illness. But for the one who is missing his lover, there can not be better than meeting his love.<br />\n<br />\nI do not know how to look<br />\nYambatta Thambata River<br />\nIf you are laughing at someone else's love and pulling his legs, it is because you never never in love.<br />\n<br />\n2. Karpiyal - This goes into the marital love. These 18 chapters come at the end of the book and deals with separation, anger, memories, complaining and feigned anger.<br />\n<br />\nYerunangan lover of love<br />\nNo one is anyone<br />\nWhen I say to her that she is dear to me than everybody, she still asks me whom I compare her with.<br />\n<br />\nOthers do not care<br />\nEye to eye<br />\nThe person who stole my heart does not seem to be interested in hugging me. I can not even find him. This is breaking my heart.<br />\n<br />\nChapter entitled \"Prostitutes\": For gold, not love their tongue cajoles men are ruined by bangled belles (911)<br />\nThe false embrance of whores is like that of a damned corpse in the dark {913)<br />\n(allusion to necrophilia,a rare sexual deviation)<br />\nThiruvalluvar considers sexuality broadly under two headings \"Courting in secrecy\" and \"Chaste married life\"<br />\nOn this banglod beauty dwell the joys of sight sound touch taste smell (1101)<br />\nJoy is the fast embrace that doth not admit even air between both (1108)<br />\nIn the fore - play the beauty of the woman is extolled in many places:--<br />\n\"Beauty extolled\"<br />\nThe bamboo shouldered has pearl like smiles Fragrant breath and lance like eyes (1J13)<br />\nThe soft flower and the swan's down are like nettles to the feet of the fair.. (1120)<br />\nA sensuous kiss between the lovers is alluded to here:--<br />\nLike milk and honey the dew is sweet from her white teeth whose word is soft (1121)<br />\nLove between me and this lady is like bond between soul and body (1122)<br />\nLife with my jewel is existence Death is is severance (1124)<br />\nAs knowledge reveals past ignorance So is the belle on love gets close ..(1110)<br />\nHe comes; no sleep; he goes; no sleep; This is the fate of eyes that weep .(II79)<br />\nNights' mercy lulls all souls to sleep keeping but me for companionship (1168)<br />\nCrueller than that cruel he are midnight hours gliding slowly (1169)<br />\nOne day seems as sever to those who yearn return of distant spouse (J269)<br />\nIn wakeful hours who sees me not I meet in dreams and linger yet... {1213)<br />\nIn dreams I enjoy his love \u2013 bliss Who in wakeful hours I miss (12 J 4)<br />\nDear life ebbs away by thought of him who said we are one heart {1209)<br />\nThink of, O heart, some remedy To cure this chronic malady {1241)<br />\nFrets to gain and fears loss in gain O my heart suffers ceaseless pain.. {1295)<br />\nThese arms that swelled on nuptial day Now shrunk proclaim \"He is away\"{1233)<br />\nBereft of bracelets and old beauty Arms tell the cruel's cruelty {1235)<br />\n<br />\nMy eyes causing lust more than sea Suffer that tortune slecplessly (1175)<br />\nHe seized my beauty and modesty Leaving pangs and pallor to me ... {1183)<br />\nLover away, comes even tide like slayer to field of homicide {1224)<br />\nSulking is the salt of love : but too much of it spoils the taste {1302)<br />\nSulking is lover's delight Its delight grows when they write {1330)<br />\n<br />\n\"Shall I draw back, or yield myself, or shall both mingled be,<br />\nWhen he returns, my spouse, dear as these eyes to me.\" (Kural 1267)[26]<br />\n\"Withdraw, it burns; approach, it soothes the pain;<br />\nWhence did the maid this wondrous fire obtain?\" (Kural 1104)[27]<br />\n\"A double witchery have glances of her liquid eyes;<br />\nOne glance is glance that brings me pain; the other heals again.\" (Kural 1091)<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_165MN\" kind=\"m\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_165BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; Dharma (righteousness, duty and moral order) 2. Artha (wealth and prosperity) 3.&nbsp;</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Kama (desirable action )</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">&nbsp;4. Moksha (liberation) . This is exactly what is condenses into Tirukkural.</span><br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">KAMA PURUSHARTHA IS NOT LUST BUT DESIRABLE ACTION.<br /><br />KAMA HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH LUST OR SEX AS IS WRITTEN BY THE WHITE INVADER</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Purushartha means those actions which are proper and correct</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Kama is a broad subject which encompasses arts, emotions, poetry . relationships and other sciences</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The aim of life of an individual is determined by the doctrine of Purushartha. It also decides the course of life of man and lays down norms and values for the behaviour patterns.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Purushartha means \u201cPurusharthate Purushartha\u201d, which are the efforts made by the individual to achieve the aims, goals and ultimate values of life.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">The ultimate end of Hindu culture is to attain \u2018Moksha\u2019 or salvation and hence, man should behave in such a manner that this aim may be achieved- and this does NOT mean wanton , debauched sex..</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">By Purushartha we mean the pursuance of those actions which lead to the fulfillment of socially approved values and goal.</span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Kama refers to all the desires in man for the enjoyment and satisfaction and sensual gratification of the five human senses.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">KAMA could be music or being creative or team spirit in sport or travelling to places of natural beauty or sitting with family at the beach or riding a fast horse or participating in a arrow shooting contest - anything which brings delight to human life and spirit .</span><br />\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">Kama has absolutely nothing to do with LUST and sexual orgasm.</span><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div style=\"font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Kama would refer to the totality of the innate desires and drives of man- motivations of man.</span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span><br />\n<div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Kama refers to the instinctive and emotional life of man, and provides for the satisfaction of his aesthetic urges.</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">Sanatana Dharma wants man and woman to be happy as this is the chief purpose of life and of course the final goal of Moksha.</span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
